location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 11/2: Jamileh and 4 others slave girls - Correspondence re.'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers in this file are arranged chronologically.

Foliation: The foliation is in pencil in the top right corner, starting and ending on the covers. The numbering begins with 1, 1a, 1b, 1c, 2, and then carries on until 30, which is the last number given on the back cover.

mods.abstract: The file contains reports and correspondence regarding five female slaves who were freed from kidnappers and sent to the Political Agency in Bahrain. The file includes documents in Arabic, a translation of a report containing statements from the five women, explaining what happened to them (folios 8-11), and copies of letters from the Political Agency in Bahrain to Dr Gerrit J Pennings at the American Mission Hospital in Bahrain requesting that the women be accommodated in the Mission for a short period of time.
